contextId.information: This is an exaggeration to say that Solomon will keep Adonijah safe. AT: "not a hair of his head will fall" or "I will keep him safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: not a hair of his will fall to the earth

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state that this caused the baby to die. AT: "accidentally rolled on top of her baby and smothered him" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: lay on him

contextId.information: Huram accepted Solomon's invitation to come to Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: brought him from Tyre

contextId.information: Here the word "He" refers to Huram and his helpers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He made

contextId.information: To "turn someone's heart" is to convince that person to change his affection. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:11:01|11:01]]. AT: "turned his heart away from Yahweh" or "persuaded him to stop worshiping Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: turned his heart away

contextId.information: The implied information is that Yahweh sent the man of God to Bethel. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh sent a man of God from Judah to Bethel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A man of God came out of Judah by the word of Yahweh to Bethel

contextId.information: The implied information is that the sons also told their father which way the man of God went. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: his sons had seen the way

contextId.information: This refers to the fifth year of Rehoboam's reign as king. AT: "in the fifth year that Rehoboam was king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: in the fifth year of King Rehoboam

contextId.information: This refers to the eighteenth year of Jeroboam's reign. AT: "After Jeroboam had been the king of Israel for almost eighteen years" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam son of Nebat

contextId.information: Since these verses refer to several kings, it may help to include the name of Abijah's father. This information can be made clear. AT "that his father, Rehoboam, had committed before Abijah's time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that his father had committed before his time

contextId.information: This is a general way to refer to the situation with Uriah. It can be stated more clearly what this matter was. AT: "except for what he did to Uriah the Hittite" or "except when he caused Uriah the Hittite to be killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: except only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite

contextId.information: This refers to the twentieth year of Jeroboam's reign. AT: "After Jeroboam had been the king of Israel for almost twenty years" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel

contextId.information: It is implied that the army of Baasha first captured Ramah. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "captured and fortified Ramah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: built up Ramah

contextId.information: This means he spoke by means of his servants. Asa told his servants what to say to Ben Hadad and they did. The meaning of this can be made clear. AT: "Asa told his servants to say to Ben Hadad" or "Through his servants, Asa said to Ben Hadad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He said

contextId.information: This refers to the second year of Asa's reign. The meaning of this can be made clear. AT: "when Asa had been king of Judah for almost two years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the second year of Asa king of Judah

contextId.information: God became angry with the people because they worshiped idols. The meaning of this can be made clear. AT: "they made Yahweh, the God of Israel, angry because they worshiped idols" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they provoked Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger with their idols

contextId.information: This treason refers to Zimri's plot to kill Elah, the king of Israel. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "how he plotted against King Elah" or "how he killed the king of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the treason that he carried out

contextId.information: God became angry with the people because they worshiped idols. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:16:11|16:13]]. AT: "to make Yahweh, the God of Israel, angry because they worshiped worthless idols" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to provoke Yahweh ... to be angry with their worthless idols

contextId.information: This implies that Ahab wanted to commit worse sins. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "It was as if Ahab thought that walking in the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat was not enough"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: It was to Ahab a trivial thing to walk in the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat

contextId.information: It is implied that they will die because they do not have anymore food. AT: "that we may eat. Afterwards, we will starve to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that we may eat it, and die

contextId.information: Elisha gave the cooked meat to the people of his city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he gave it to the people

contextId.information: This phrase is an oath that emphasizes that what follows will not happen. AT: "Because Yahweh forbids it, I will never give" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh forbid that I should give

contextId.information: Here "Israel" refers to all twelve tribes of Israel and not just to the northern kingdom. AT: "removed from the presence of the people of Israel" or "drove out of the land before the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: removed before the people of Israel

contextId.information: "you will know the answer to your question." If Zedekiah's rhetorical question is translated as a statement, this phrase may be translated to supply implicit information. AT: "you will know that the Spirit of Yahweh has spoken to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you will know that
